root.name: Fighters Megamix
root.description: Released towards the end of the Saturn's life, Fighters Megamix combined 2 of the company's most popular fighting games, and throws in a ton of extra content and characters for good measure. Being a "crossover" game, Fighters Megamix combined play elements from both Virtua Fighter and Fighting Vipers. Notably, characters received foreground/background dodge moves (from Virtua Fighter 3), air recoveries (Vipers), and armor-piercing attacks (Vipers).Character RosterVirtua FighterAkira YukiPai ChanLau ChanWolf HawkfieldJeffry McWildKage-MaruSarah BryantJacky BryantShun-DiLion RafaleDuralFighting VipersGraceBahnRaxelTokioSanmanJaneCandyPickyMahlerBig MahlerKumachanBonus CharactersSiba (axed character from Virtua Fighter)Rent-A-Hero ( Rent-A-Hero)Kids Akira ( Virtua Fighter Kids)Kids Sarah (Virtua Fighter Kids)Bean the Dynamite ( Sonic Championship)Bark the Polar Bear (Sonic Championship)Janet Marshall ( Virtua Cop 2, with moves cribbed from Aoi Umenokouji from Virtua Fighter 3)Deku (original character)Hornet ( Daytona USA)URA Bahn (re-tooled version of Bahn)Mr. Meat (extra costume for Kumachan, unlocked with 30 game boots)AM2 Palm Tree (extra costume for Kumachan, unlocked after 84 hours of play)Unlike most other fighting games for the Saturn, Fighters Megamix never had an Arcade release. A version was also released for Tiger's Game.com portable system.
